SEARCH

Uses of Package
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream

Packages that use edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream
Package
Description
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream
This package is used to represent a Xilinx FPGA bitstream file.
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configuration
This package emulates an FPGA that can be configured with the Bitstream class and can also be read back to create bitstreams.
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configurationSpecification
This package specifies the bitstream details of the architectures supported and contains classes to automatically generate new part libraries.
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.examples
This package contains several examples of how to use the bitstream tools contained in RapidSmith.
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.examples.support
This package contains some supporting classes for the examples given in the bitstream tools in RapidSmith.
  • Classes in edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream used by edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream
    Class
    Description
    Bitstream
    Represents a Xilinx bitstream.
    BitstreamException
    An exception that indicates an invalid Bitstream.
    BitstreamHeader
    This class contains all of the information in a configuration bitstream header.
    BitstreamParseException
     
    ConfigurationData
    abstract class meant to be the base class of anything that can produce configuration data (DummySyncData, Packet, and PacketList).
    CRC
    Several cyclic redundancy checks are performed while the bitstream is being loaded.
    DummySyncData
    Represents the dummy sync data found in Xilinx bitstreams.
    Packet
    A bitstream is made up of packets.
    PacketList
    A list of Packet objects.
    PacketOpcode
    In both type 1 and 2 packets, bits 28:27 of the header determine the opcode
    Opcode 00: NOP
    Opcode 01: Read
    Opcode 10: Write
    Opcode 11: Reserved
    PacketType
    There are two packets types: One and Two.
    RegisterType
    In a type 1 packet, the register is specified by bits 26:13, however only 17:13 are currently used, 26:18 are reserved
    CRC Read/Write 00000 CRC register
    FAR Read/Write 00001 Frame Address Register
    FDRI Write 00010 Frame Data Register, Input (write configuration data)
    FDRO Read 00011 Frame Data Register, Output register (read configuration data)
    CMD Read/Write 00100 Command Register
    CTL Read/Write 00101 Control Register
    MASK Read/Write 00110 Masking Register for CTL
    STAT Read 00111 Status Register
    LOUT Write 01000 Legacy Output Register (DOUT for daisy chain)
    COR Read/Write 01001 Configuration Option Register
    MFWR Write 01010 Multiple Frame Write
    CBC Write 01011 Initial CBC value register
    IDCODE Read/Write 01100 Device ID register
    AXSS Read/Write 01101 User bitstream access register
    COR1 Read/Write 01110 Configuration Option Register 1
    CSOB Write 01111 Used for daisy chain parallel interface
    WBSTAR Read/Write 10000 Warm Boot Start Address Register
    TIMER Read/Write 10001 Watchdog Timer Register
    BOOTSTSRead/Write 10110 Watchdog Timer Register
    CTL1 Read/Write 11000 Watchdog Timer Register
    UNKNOWN0 Unknown 10011 This is an undocumented register in V5 bitstreams
  • Classes in edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.bitstream used by edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configuration

    PacketListCRC
    Extends the PacketList object by computing the CRC of packets that are created.
